text: Is the Lilypad a good Arduino platform for someone to begin on? My friend is looking for a gift for her husband (thinking he might want to make a wearable/clothing project). I haven't used Lilypad myself, but it looks cool.
nano + a breadboard is probably the best for beginning. has usb, breadboard is best for learning/prototyping. best to play there and then wire up the final thing on the lilypad I'd think

I would suggest going with a larger Arduino board that can take standard shields so that he can easily drop in other hardware. Following Josh's suggestion, having a breadboard would be indispensable. I'd recommend an Arduino Uno + Sparkfun ProtoShield + mini breadboard:
